candidates.name: Jessamine Fraser
candidates.why_elect: As an architect with my own practice, and an architectural design tutor, I have an expert understanding of urban and housing issues, and experience working with diverse groups and leading interdisciplinary teams solving complex problems.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see Auckland become an equitable, resilient, sustainable city, where we can all thrive in our changing world.

candidates.name: Ross Clow
candidates.why_elect: I am an experience and able community advocate with a proven record of achievement in West Auckland and Greater Auckland affairs.
candidates.why_stand: I want to ensure the delivery of key Whau projects—Avondale Library/Community Centre, New Lynn Central park and Whau Swimming Pool/Recreation Centre. As a regional councillor continue the work in delivering a sophisticated, celebrated world city of note.

candidates.name: Anne Degia-Pala
candidates.why_elect: I am a local in the Ward I wish to represent. I have lived here for over 30 years and operate a business in the local area. I know the community and I engage with all diversity. I am known through my work in injury prevention in West Auckland.
candidates.why_stand: I love the diversity that our population in Auckland reflects with over 200 ethnic groups speaking 180 languages. I believe that we need representation and inclusive leadership for all and as a strategic governance practitioner and a community engagements collaborator, I am standing to be of service in council.
